meanings.definition: A triangular gable found over a portico or window.
meanings.sent1: The pediment above the entrance added a classic touch to the building.
meanings.sent2: The architect included a pediment in the design to enhance the facade.
meanings.sent3: The pigeons perched on the pediment, pretending to be guardians of the entrance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a pediment, framing her face with elegance and grace.
meanings.sent5: The pediment stood proudly against the sky, a symbol of architectural beauty.

meanings.definition: A low-pitched gable above a facade.
meanings.sent1: The pediment on the old house gave it a charming, traditional look.
meanings.sent2: The pediment provided shade over the entrance, shielding visitors from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found a cozy spot under the pediment, enjoying the view from above.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed under the pediment, reaching every corner of the courtyard.
meanings.sent5: The pediment loomed overhead, like a protective canopy over the building.
